teaser: First up, Pai-Ling Yin, a researcher at the Stanford Institute for Economic Policy Research, talks about what the Apple Watch means for developers thinking about entering the wearable device market. Then, Jordan Pearson, a technology and culture writer and contributor to Motherboard, joins us to discuss how texting can be used to improve healthcare services across a community.
title: Marketplace Tech for Thursday, September 11, 2014
description: First up, Pai-Ling Yin, a researcher at the Stanford Institute for Economic Policy Research, talks about what the Apple Watch means for developers thinking about entering the wearable device market. Then, Jordan Pearson, a technology and culture writer and contributor to Motherboard, joins us to discuss how texting can be used to improve healthcare services across a community.
